e4: While investors accustomed to adjusting earnings might initially react negatively, the current practice relies on a hidden bias. This creates legal risk and undermines trust in the long run. Embracing transparency through unbiased reporting builds stronger relationships with all stakeholders and sets ABC up for ethical and sustainable success.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy. It presents information truthfully, without manipulation or hidden biases, allowing investors to make informed decisions.  Beyond legal compliance, it considers the long-term impact on stakeholder trust and the company's reputation. Open communication about any changes in methodology further builds confidence and fosters a sustainable relationship with the financial community.
